stream_context.summary: Kaze continues building the overworld of "Return to Yoshi's Island."  Most of the session is spent tweaking sand/grass/rock textures, experimenting with shoreline foam, and reviewing a new overworld track from Badub.  He also dives into low-level engine work (linked-list removal, const optimization) and battles Fast64 export bugs.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is sculpting the overworld terrain, adjusting sand, grass and rock transitions and raising dunes for a more natural look.
A shoreline foam effect is being prototyped at 60 FPS, but function-flag logic and visual limitations may force its removal.
development_findings.quote: Seeing this, I don't believe in it anymore – we might have to just say no sand.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 currently introduces an export/render bug that breaks random mode and corrupts vertex colours; Kaze is waiting for a fix.
development_findings.quote: It's a fast 64 bug – nothing I can do about it right now.

development_findings.summary: Old audio plugin degraded music quality; Kaze swapped to a new plugin, improving the soundtrack playback.
development_findings.quote: I had to change the audio plugin, because there was a bug in the old audio plugin that made the music sound terrible.

development_findings.summary: Badub delivered an updated Course 1 theme and a new overworld track that largely re-uses vanilla SM64 instruments.
Kaze replaced traditional linked lists with hash-mapped back-links to avoid cache pollution, improving performance on N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: The links do not set up data cache unless you're specifically looking for them, which you only do on level load.

development_findings.summary: Live experiment proved the 'const' keyword lets the compiler remove two memory loads and four instructions on MIPS, highlighting small but real optimisation gains.
development_findings.quote: Remove the const, compile again – four instructions gone.

development_findings.summary: Sauraen is building a modified legacy vertex pipeline to enable Fresno-style packed vertices; Kaze cannot test certain visual features until this lands.
Overworld is projected to hold 20–30 stars and will evolve over time (e.g., environmental changes, new NPC states).
development_findings.quote: How many stars in your world?  Probably between 20 and 30.

development_findings.summary: Design idea: all palm trees will hold kickable coconuts that drop 0–5 coins and can be used to wake a sleeping NPC.
Static light-mapping is ruled out because N64 supports only one UV set, making proper light-maps impractical.
Link-time optimisation is desirable but currently incompatible with the SM64 tool-chain Kaze uses.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes spending money; still uses a decade-old phone but will review a free replacement.
context_findings.quote: My phone is so old it cannot play YouTube videos – I hate spending money.

context_findings.summary: He formerly lived in northwest Germany and mentions living with a 15 % sales tax.
Kaze is an aquarium hobbyist (pleco, guppies, shrimp) and plans to add bristlenose plecos.
context_findings.quote: You guys know what I love?  I love keeping fishes.

context_findings.summary: He benches 315 lbs after five years of training and views 225 lbs as a good goal for most men.
Kaze values accuracy and is willing to be corrected publicly, as shown during the 'const' debate.
context_findings.quote: I just care about becoming as good as possible.

context_findings.summary: Avoids discussing politics/AI on stream; jokingly blames Biobak if chat drifts there.
Family detail: child nicknamed "Debooba" (term coined by Zeina).

biobak.summary: Gives ongoing visual feedback on shoreline foam and sends revised graphics (e.g., bunny footprints).
Will refine Kaze’s placeholder textures once layout is locked.

badub.summary: Composed the new overworld theme and revised Course 1 music; tracks already trending on SoundCloud.

zeina.summary: Provided a properly formatted footprint texture (128 × 32 with rotations) during the stream.
Coined the nickname "Debooba" for their child; casual presence in chat (joked about the heater noise).

key_stories.title: The Const Debate
key_stories.summary: A viewer insisted the C 'const' keyword offers no optimisation.  Kaze live-edited code, re-compiled, showed MIPS assembly, and proved const removed two memory loads and four instructions.
key_stories.challenge: Viewer claims const provides no performance benefit.
key_stories.process: Kaze removed const qualifiers, compared code size and assembly in real time.
key_stories.outcome: Viewer conceded; Kaze reinforced his commitment to empirical proof.
key_stories.key_quote: I can prove it to you right now – remove the const, compile again – four instructions gone.

key_stories.title: Foamy Waves Conundrum
key_stories.summary: Kaze attempts to add animated shoreline foam but encounters flag logic bugs and visual artefacts.
key_stories.challenge: Render function stops after first call, and decal approach looks wrong.
key_stories.process: Debugged flag increments, switched to draw layer, experimented with multi-texture and scrolling decals.
key_stories.outcome: Feature is currently shelved; may ship without foam unless a better solution emerges.
key_stories.key_quote: Seeing this, I don't believe in it anymore – we might have to just say no sand.

key_stories.title: Audio Plugin Switch
key_stories.summary: Music playback sounded bad due to an old audio plugin.
key_stories.process: Identified plugin bug and swapped to a newer plugin.
key_stories.outcome: Soundtrack clearer; new Badub tracks showcased.
key_stories.key_quote: I had to change the audio plugin, because there was a bug in the old audio plugin that made the music sound terrible.

open_questions.context: Kaze says the overworld will "change throughout the game" but gave no specifics.
questions: How many distinct evolution stages are planned for the overworld?
What in-game events trigger each stage?
Are changes purely cosmetic or do they unlock new gameplay paths?

open_questions.context: Sauraen is creating a legacy vertex pipeline that enables Fresno-like packed vertices, blocking some visual features.
questions: Which concrete features depend on Fresno support?
What is the expected delivery timeline?
Is there a contingency plan if it is delayed?

open_questions.topic: Random mode bug attributed to Lilaa
open_questions.context: Export programming fix introduced a "random mode" bug; Kaze jokes about yelling at Lilaa.
questions: What exactly does the random mode bug do?
How critical is it to the build?
Who is responsible for fixing it and what is the ETA?

open_questions.context: Idea to let coconuts drop coins and wake sleeping NPCs is only conceptual.
questions: Will the coconut mechanic definitely ship?
How will the interaction be communicated to players?
Who will handle animation, sound, and level scripting for it?

open_questions.context: Kaze wants LTO for speed but says it's "not easy" with SM64.
questions: Could a different compiler tool-chain solve the issue?
What performance gain is expected if it works?
